title.text: A SIMPLIFIED THEORY OF TENSE REPRESENTATIONS AND CONSTRAINTS ON THEIR COMPOSITION

abstractContent.text: This paper proposes a set of representations for tenses and a set of constraints on how they can be combined in adjunct clauses.
The semantics we propose explains the possible meanings of tenses in a variety of sen-tential contexts.
It also supports an elegant constraint on tense combination in adjunct clauses.
These semantic representations provide insights into the interpretations of tenses, and the constraints provide a source of syntactic disambiguation that has not previously been demonstrated.
We demonstrate an implemented disambiguator fora certain class of three-clause sentences based on our theory.
